JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Guido Raimondi;Kristina Pardalos;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON , Agent , ORG and ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant , at the material time a member and activist of ORG ) , a registered left - wing political party , was convicted by ORG under LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW of the offence of having worn a totalitarian symbol in public . The court observed that the applicant had worn a CARDINAL - pointed red star and a sickle - and - hammer logo on several occasions of public appearance . The court refrained from imposing a sentence for DATE . On DATE ORG upheld this judgment .

On DATE ORG adopted a judgment in a case introduced by another individual on account of a conviction similar in nature ( PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , DATE ) . The ORG held that prosecution for having worn a red star amounted to a violation of that applicant ’s freedom of expression enshrined in LAW . In pursuit of this judgment , on DATE ORG review bench acquitted the defendant in that case holding that his incriminated act no longer represented danger to society .
Act no . DATE on LAW provides :

“ ( CARDINAL ) A criminal offence is an act perpetrated intentionally or DATE if the law also punishes negligent perpetration – by negligence , which represents a danger for society and for which the law orders the infliction of punishment .
( CARDINAL ) An activity or omission shall be an act dangerous to society if it violates or endangers the constitutional , social or economic order of GPE , or the person or rights of citizens . ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) Any person who ( a ) disseminates , ( b ) uses in public or ( c ) exhibits a swastika , an ORG - badge , an arrow - cross , a symbol of the sickle - and - hammer or a CARDINAL - pointed red star , or a symbol depicting any of them , commits an offence – unless a more serious crime has been committed – and shall be sentenced to a fine .

( CARDINAL ) The conduct prescribed under paragraph ( CARDINAL ) is not punishable if it is done for the purposes of education , science , art or in order to provide information about history or contemporary events .
( CARDINAL ) PERSON ( CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) do not apply to the insignia of GPE which are in force . ”
Act No . ORG of DATE on Criminal Procedure provides :
“ ( CARDINAL ) [ ... R]eview proceedings may be initiated ... if ... ( a ) a person ... was convicted ... in breach of the substantive provisions of criminal law ... ”
“ ( CARDINAL ) The rules of third - instance proceedings ( LAW ) shall be applicable to the conduct of the review proceedings ... ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) The third - instance court may reverse the second - instance court ’s judgment and adopt a lawful decision if the second - instance court gave its judgment in breach of the [ substantive ] provisions of criminal law ... provided that the findings of fact are well - founded or their deficiency could be rectified before the third - instance court . ”

In case no . PERSON . II.CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( judgment of DATE ) which concerned the prosecution of a Mr F. for having displayed a red star , ORG examined in detail whether or not PERSON conduct represented any danger to society DATE an element inherent in the notion of a crime within the meaning of section CARDINAL of LAW ( see above ) DATE and this in particular in the face of the PERSON judgment cited above .
